items.title: Effective Interaction Radius
items.content:
1410: :label: cor-effective-interaction-radius-full
1411: 
1412: Define the **effective interaction radius** by setting the tail probability to $\delta = 1/k$:
1413: 
1414: $$
1415: R_{\text{eff}} = \sqrt{R_{\max}^2 + 2\varepsilon_c^2 \log(k^2)} = \varepsilon_c \sqrt{C_{\text{comp}}^2 + 2\log(k^2)}
1416: 
1417: $$
1418: 
1419: Then:
1420: 
1421: $$
1422: \mathbb{P}(d_{\text{alg}}(i, c(i)) > R_{\text{eff}}) \leq \frac{1}{k}
1423: 
1424: $$

items.label: cor-gevrey-1-fitness-potential-full
items.title: Gevrey-1 Classification
items.content:
4682: :label: cor-gevrey-1-fitness-potential-full
4683: 
4684: The fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}$ belongs to the **Gevrey-1 class**, meaning it is **real-analytic** with convergent Taylor series in a neighborhood of each point.
4685: 
4686: Specifically, for any compact set $K \subset \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d$:
4687: 
4688: $$
4689: \sup_{(x,v) \in K} \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}(x,v)\| \leq A \cdot B^m \cdot m!
4690: 
4691: $$

items.label: cor-exponential-qsd-companion-dependent-full
items.title: Exponential Convergence to QSD (Conditional)
items.content:
5025: :label: cor-exponential-qsd-companion-dependent-full
5026: 
5027: **If** {prf:ref}`conj-lsi-companion-dependent-full` holds, then the Geometric Gas with companion-dependent fitness converges exponentially to its unique quasi-stationary distribution:
5028: 
5029: $$
5030: \|\rho_t - \nu_{\text{QSD}}\|_{L^2(\mu)} \leq e^{-\lambda_{\text{gap}} t} \|\rho_0 - \nu_{\text{QSD}}\|_{L^2(\mu)}
5031: 
5032: $$
5033: 
5034: where $\lambda_{\text{gap}} \geq \alpha > 0$ is the **spectral gap**, independent of $N$ and $k$.

items.label: cor-gevrey-closure
items.title: Gevrey-1 Closure Under Smooth Composition
items.content:
5457: :label: cor-gevrey-closure
5458: 
5459: If $f: \mathbb{R}^k \to \mathbb{R}$ is Gevrey-1 (satisfies $\|\nabla^m f\| \leq C_f m! \rho^{-m}$) and $g_1, \ldots, g_k: \mathbb{R}^d \to \mathbb{R}$ are each Gevrey-1 with $\|\nabla^m g_i\| \leq C_i m! \sigma^{-m}$, then the composition:
5460: 
5461: $$
5462: h(x) = f(g_1(x), \ldots, g_k(x))
5463: 
5464: $$
5465: 
5466: is Gevrey-1 with:
5467: 
5468: $$
5469: \|\nabla^m h\| \leq C_h m! \cdot \max(\rho, \sigma)^{-m}
5470: 
5471: $$
